bibl.title: P. H. McNamara v. John H. McGraw. Application for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Territory of Washington County of King ss.
In the District Court of the 3rd Judicial District of Washington Territory. Holding terms at Seattle for said County of King - In Chambers -
In the matter of the application of P. H. McNamara for a writ of Habeas Corpus. Petition

Your petitioner P. H. McNamara respectfully shows that he is unlawfully imprisoned, detained confined and restricted of his liberty at the County King Co. Jail W. T. by John H McGraw Sheriff and other parties unknown to this affiant.

That the said detention confinement and inprisonment and restrait are illegal - and that the illegality thereof coexists in this to-wit: Because said petitioner is not held by any warrant of arrest or by any warrant of committment nor is he held by any warrant or process of laws

Wherefore your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted, directed to John H. McGraw Sheriff of King County W. T. and others commanding them to have the body of P. H. McNamara before your honor forthwith, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered by your honor concerning him in this behalf and that your petitioner may be restored to his liberty. Dated Aug 19th 1889. x P H McNamara

Territory of Washington County of King P H McNamara Being duly sworn deposes and says that he is the petitioner named in the foregoing petition subscribed by him, that he has heaerd the foregoing petition read and known the contents thereof and has no statements therein made he believes to be true. P H McNamara
